name: indiscreetly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you say or do things indiscreetly, you say or do things that should be secret or that embarrass people: He indiscreetly revealed his guilt and his brother’s involvement. The two were chattering loudly and indiscreetly about their husbands. See
indiscreet
More examplesFewer examplesThe car was parked indiscreetly, behind a thin screen of trees.His former teammates were angry that he had written about them indiscreetly in his autobiography.She had spoken indiscreetly to the press.
